acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: It is documented that its rat LD50 = 909 mg/kg bw (GESTIS (accessed in September 2008)), and its rat LDLo > 2000 mg/kg bw (RTECS (2006)). However, since there is no sufficient data available, the substance was classified into "Classification not possible".

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: It is documented that its rat LC value = > 90 mg/m3/4h (RTECS (2006)). However, since there is no sufficient data available, the substance was classified into "Classification not possible".

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Among four rat LD50 values of 200, 565 mg/kg bw (GESTIS (accessed in September 2008)), 330 mg/kg (RTECS (2006)), and 284 mg/kg (SITTIG (5th, 2008)), two are in the range of Category 3, and two Category 4. The higher Category 3 was adopted.

carcinogenicity.rationale: It is reported that subcutaneous administration to mice and rats showed oncogenicity in the administered sites (RTECS (accessed in September 2008)). However, since there is no other data available, classification is not possible.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_solids.rationale: The substance is rated UNRTDG 4.1 III * ERG 133.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: It is reported that a micronucleous test on mice only resulted in a weak clastogenic effect (GESTIS (accessed in September 2008)). However, there is no other in vivo test data or multi-index in vitro mutagenicity test results available, and classification is not possible. As relevant information, as for in vitro tests, in an Ames test, some strains showed positive results (NTP DB (accessed in September 2008)).

organic_peroxides.rationale: Organic compounds containing no bivalent -O-O- structure in the molecule

self_reactive_substances.rationale: The substance is rated UNRTDG 4.1. However, due to a lack of data, classification is not possible.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: It is reported that in a test using rats and rabbits, the substance did not cause irritation, or only caused slight conjunctivitis (GESTIS (accessed in September 2008)). However, since there is no sufficient data available, the substance was classified into "Classification not possible".

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on results that in rats or rabbits, the substance did not cause irritation (GESTIS (accessed in September 2008)), and neither irritative nor other reactions were found on humans (GESTIS (accessed in September 2008)), the substance was classified into "Not classified".

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: It is reported that in a rat 13-week oral administration test, changes in erythrocyte count and leukocyte count were found (RTECS (2006)). However, since there is no sufficient data available, the substance was classified into "Classification not possible".

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: In an oral administration test using rats, a dose of 330 mg/kg which falls under the Category 2 guidance values (and is equivalent to the LD50 value) was reported to cause anemia (RTECS (2005)). In an inhalation exposure test using rats (four hours), at the dose of 0.03 mg/L, which is equivalent to the guidance value of Category 1, an increase of the methemoglobin value to 15.4% was found (GESTIS (accessed in September 2008)). In an oral administration test using rats, at the dose of 0.03 mg/L, which is equivalent to the guidance value of Category 1, an increase of the methemoglobin value to 38.5% was found (GESTIS (accessed in September 2008)). Therefore, the substance was classified into Category 1 (hematopoietic system).
